intro: Phlegmariurus lindenii, commonly known as the red-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that form dense, cushion-like structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its stems are reddish in color, which distinguishes it from other clubmoss species. Phlegmariurus lindenii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
